content.question: Cholinesterase is an enzyme that catalyzes the hydrolysis of the signaling molecule acetylcholine. Which of the following best explains how cholinesterase carries out its function?

choices.label: Cholinesterase breaks covalent bonds within acetylcholine by the addition of a water molecule.
Cholinesterase breaks covalent bonds within acetylcholine by removing a water molecule.
Cholinesterase forms covalent bonds between acetylcholine and another molecule by the addition of a water molecule.
Cholinesterase forms covalent bonds between acetylcholine and another molecule by removing a water molecule.

content.answer: Cholinesterase breaks covalent bonds within acetylcholine by the addition of a water molecule.

skill.text: 1.C: Explain biological concepts and processes in applied contexts.
